clues: A 47-year-old woman presents with three days of worsening productive cough that is now interfering with her sleep.
She reports fever, chills, pleuritic chest pain, and increasing shortness of breath, especially with exertion.
On exam, she appears mildly ill and is tachypneic, with a respiratory rate of 24. She also notes fatigue and decreased appetite.
Auscultation of the lungs reveals focal crackles and bronchial breath sounds over the right lower lobe.
A chest X-ray shows a right lower-lobe consolidation
A 1-year-old infant is brought in for recurrent episodes of sudden, brief flexion of the torso and arms occurring in clusters.
Parents report developmental regression over the past month and decreased interaction and responsiveness.
Physical exam reveals several hypomelanotic ‘ash-leaf’ macules on the trunk and legs, more visible under a Wood’s lamp.
Parents mention that a cardiac rhabdomyoma was detected at birth during a murmur workup.
EEG shows a hypsarrhythmia pattern consistent with infantile spasms.
A 65-year-old man with a history of COPD presents with fever, productive cough, and shortness of breath for 4 days.
He reports purulent sputum and pleuritic chest pain.
On exam, he is febrile, tachycardic, and auscultation reveals crackles and wheezing in the right upper lobe.
Chest X-ray shows patchy consolidation in the right upper lobe.
Lab work reveals leukocytosis with a left shift.
A 55-year-old man presents for routine checkup and reports increased thirst, frequent urination, and unexplained weight loss over the past 3 months.
He has a family history of type 2 diabetes and leads a sedentary lifestyle.
On exam, he is overweight and has acanthosis nigricans on the back of his neck.
Lab work shows fasting glucose of 160 mg/dL and HbA1c of 8.2%.
Urinalysis shows glucosuria without ketones.
A 22-year-old man presents with 12 hours of abdominal pain, initially periumbilical but now localized to the right lower quadrant.
He reports nausea and one episode of vomiting, with loss of appetite.
On exam, he has tenderness at McBurney's point and positive Rovsing sign.
Laboratory studies reveal mild leukocytosis.
Ultrasound shows a non-compressible, enlarged appendix.
A 14-year-old girl presents with episodic wheezing, cough, and shortness of breath, worse at night and during exercise.
Symptoms often follow upper respiratory infections.
She has a history of atopic dermatitis and allergic rhinitis.
Pulmonary function tests show reversible airway obstruction after bronchodilator administration.
Physical exam reveals diffuse expiratory wheezing.
A 70-year-old woman suddenly develops right-sided weakness and slurred speech.
Her symptoms began 1 hour ago while watching TV.
On exam, she has right facial droop, right upper and lower extremity weakness, and expressive aphasia.
CT scan of the head shows no hemorrhage.
MRI confirms an acute infarct in the left middle cerebral artery territory.
A 35-year-old woman presents with palpitations, weight loss despite increased appetite, and heat intolerance.
She reports increased sweating and nervousness.
On exam, she has a diffuse goiter and exophthalmos.
Laboratory tests reveal suppressed TSH and elevated free T4 and T3.
Thyroid uptake scan shows diffusely increased uptake.
A 60-year-old man presents with sudden-onset severe substernal chest pain radiating to the left arm and jaw.
He is diaphoretic and nauseated.
Past medical history includes hypertension and hyperlipidemia.
ECG shows ST-segment elevation in leads II, III, and aVF.
Troponin I levels are significantly elevated.
A 28-year-old tall, thin man presents with sudden-onset right-sided pleuritic chest pain and shortness of breath.
He denies trauma.
On exam, breath sounds are absent on the right side, with hyperresonance to percussion.
Vital signs show mild tachypnea and tachycardia.
Chest X-ray confirms a right-sided pneumothorax.
A 45-year-old woman presents with right upper quadrant abdominal pain radiating to the right shoulder.
She reports nausea and vomiting after eating fatty meals.
On exam, she has tenderness in the right upper quadrant and a positive Murphy sign.
Ultrasound reveals gallstones and thickened gallbladder wall.
Laboratory studies show mild leukocytosis and elevated liver enzymes.
A 60-year-old man with a history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes presents for routine follow-up.
He reports fatigue and swelling in his lower legs.
Lab tests reveal elevated serum creatinine and decreased eGFR.
Urinalysis shows proteinuria and hematuria.
Renal ultrasound shows bilaterally small kidneys with increased echogenicity.
A 24-year-old woman presents with dysuria, urinary frequency, and suprapubic discomfort for 2 days.
She denies fever, chills, or flank pain.
She is sexually active and recently started a new relationship.
Urinalysis shows positive leukocyte esterase and nitrites.
Urine culture grows Escherichia coli.
A 68-year-old man presents with progressive memory loss over the past year.
His family reports difficulty managing finances and frequent repetition of questions.
Neurologic exam is otherwise normal.
MRI shows hippocampal atrophy.
Cognitive testing reveals impaired short-term memory.
A 30-year-old woman presents with fatigue and shortness of breath on exertion.
She reports heavy menstrual bleeding.
Physical exam shows conjunctival pallor.
Labs reveal low hemoglobin, low ferritin, and elevated TIBC.
Peripheral smear shows microcytic hypochromic red blood cells.
A 55-year-old man presents with progressive dysphagia to solids and liquids.
He reports unintentional weight loss.
He has a long history of smoking and alcohol use.
Barium swallow shows irregular esophageal narrowing.
Endoscopy confirms malignant cells.
A 19-year-old college student presents with fever, sore throat, and fatigue.
Physical exam reveals posterior cervical lymphadenopathy.
He has splenomegaly.
Monospot test is positive.
CBC shows atypical lymphocytes.

cases.diagnosis: Heart failure with reduced ejection fraction
clues: A 60-year-old man presents with dyspnea on exertion and leg swelling.
He has a history of hypertension and prior myocardial infarction.
Physical exam reveals crackles and pitting edema.
Echocardiogram shows reduced ejection fraction.
Chest X-ray shows cardiomegaly.
A 26-year-old woman presents with joint pain and fatigue.
She has a malar rash that worsens with sun exposure.
Urinalysis shows proteinuria.
Labs reveal anti-dsDNA antibodies.
Complement levels are low.
A 72-year-old man presents with resting tremor and slowness of movement.
He has a shuffling gait and difficulty initiating motion.
Physical exam reveals cogwheel rigidity.
Symptoms improve with levodopa.
Brain imaging is unremarkable.
A 45-year-old woman presents with episodic headaches and palpitations.
She reports sweating during episodes.
Blood pressure is intermittently elevated.
Plasma metanephrines are elevated.
CT scan reveals an adrenal mass.
A 38-year-old man presents with severe epigastric pain radiating to the back.
Pain began after heavy alcohol intake.
He has nausea and vomiting.
Serum lipase is markedly elevated.
CT scan shows pancreatic inflammation.
A 5-year-old child presents with barking cough and inspiratory stridor.
Symptoms worsen at night.
He has a low-grade fever.
Chest X-ray shows a steeple sign.
Symptoms improve with nebulized epinephrine.
A 62-year-old man presents with painless hematuria.
He has a long history of smoking.
Urinalysis shows numerous red blood cells.
CT urogram reveals a bladder mass.
Cystoscopy confirms malignancy.
A 40-year-old woman presents with sudden-onset dyspnea and pleuritic chest pain.
She recently underwent knee surgery.
Vital signs reveal tachycardia and hypoxia.
D-dimer is elevated.
CT pulmonary angiography confirms emboli.
A 21-year-old man with type 1 diabetes presents with nausea and abdominal pain.
He has missed several insulin doses.
Physical exam shows fruity breath and Kussmaul respirations.
Labs show hyperglycemia, metabolic acidosis, and ketonemia.
Urinalysis is positive for ketones.
A 29-year-old woman presents with unilateral throbbing headache.
She reports nausea and photophobia.
Symptoms are preceded by visual aura.
Neurologic exam is normal.
Pain improves with triptan therapy.
A 65-year-old man presents with chronic knee pain worsened by activity.
Pain improves with rest.
Morning stiffness lasts less than 30 minutes.
X-ray shows joint space narrowing and osteophytes.
Inflammatory markers are normal.
A 48-year-old man presents with burning epigastric pain.
Pain improves with eating.
He frequently uses NSAIDs.
Endoscopy shows a gastric ulcer.
Biopsy is negative for malignancy.
A 70-year-old man presents with fever and confusion.
Vital signs reveal hypotension and tachycardia.
Labs show elevated lactate and leukocytosis.
Blood cultures are positive for gram-negative bacteria.
He requires IV fluids and broad-spectrum antibiotics.
